revised_title: Imperial Salt-Works of Sówar in Upper Hungary: A Detailed Description
tldr: This article provides a detailed account of the Imperial Salt-Works of Sówar in Upper Hungary, including its history, mining methods, and the production of various types of salt. The author, Sir Hans Sloane, describes the process of extracting salt from the rock, the quality and uses of the salt, and the unique features of the salt mines, such as the Chapel cut into the rock salt and the "flowers of salt" that grow in the mines.
